question: Which industry has more 'Quantitative' metrics to disclose in Table 1 between Metals & Mining and Electrical & Electronic Equipment industries?
optionE: It cannot be determined from the given information
reference_text: | Greenhouse Gas Emissions | Gross global Scope 1 emissions, percentage covered under emissions-limiting regulations | Quantitative | Metric tons (t) CO2-e, Percentage (%) | EM-MM-110a.1 |

question: Are there any common sustainability topics between the Metals & Mining and Electrical & Electronic Equipment industries? If so, how do their reporting requirements differ?
optionA: Both industries report on Energy Management, but Metals & Mining includes water management while Electrical & Electronic Equipment includes product lifecycle management.
optionB: Both industries report on Greenhouse Gas Emissions, but Metals & Mining includes energy management while Electrical & Electronic Equipment includes water management.
optionC: Both industries report on Water Management, but Metals & Mining includes energy management while Electrical & Electronic Equipment includes greenhouse gas emissions.
optionD: Both industries report on Product Lifecycle Management, but Metals & Mining includes greenhouse gas emissions while Electrical & Electronic Equipment includes energy management.
optionE: Both industries report on Energy Management, but Metals & Mining includes greenhouse gas emissions while Electrical & Electronic Equipment includes product lifecycle management.
